page.title: 02Burscough Landscape
page.content: " There is nothing on the mere but farms,no churches or Sunday schools, cinemas or inns,no clustering villages".This description was written after a visit to a local farm over thirt years ago.With a few changes it is accurate today.Much of the land is a drained lake bed less than ten feet above sea-level.To the south and east gentle slopes rise to just over twenty five feet in the form of a low sandstone ridge.The land cover is farmland,with fields of potatoes carrots,barley and peas separated by drainage ditches.The Leeds-Liverpool canal runs to the north parallel with the Southport to Wigan railway.The villages are where the canal is crossed by roads at Heatons Bridge,Crabtree Bridge,and New Lane.To the south on higher ground is an industrial estate.
